title: Directors. Bond directors. Our top 5 movie-makers who could take over from Sam Mendes
text:
Directors. Bond directors. Our top 5 movie-makers who could take over from Sam Mendes Directors. Bond directors. Our top 5 movie-makers who could take over from Sam Mendes 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Now that director Sam Mendes will not be at the helm for any more Bond films, the question is who replaces him? 
The 50-year-old directed Daniel Craig in 2012 hit Skyfall and the latest instalment, Spectre. Sam Mendes (Joel Ryan/AP/PA) 
“I said no to the last one and then ended up doing it, and was pilloried by all my friends. But I do think this is probably it,” he told BBC Radio’s Test Match Special. 
As Sam Mendes vacates the 007 hot-seat, we present 5 possibilities for Bond 25. 1. Christopher Nolan 
Best known for: The Dark Knight trilogy, his hugely-successful reboot of the Batman film franchise. 
Other notable films: Memento (2000). Insomnia (2002). The Prestige (2006). Inception (2010) and Interstellar (2014). 
Bond credential: First and foremost, he’s a fan. “I love James Bond and I’ve talked with the producers over the years, but nothing’s ever worked out,” Nolan told Entertainment Weekly. 2. Guy Ritchie Guy Ritchie (Ian West/PA) Best known for: The man behind British gangster films Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels and Snatch. And he was married to Madonna.
Other notable films: Revolver (2005). RocknRolla (2008). Sherlock Holmes (2009). Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows (2011) The Man From U.N.C.L.E. (2015). Promoted stories 
Bond credential: He has previously been installed as the bookies’ favourite to take over from Sam Mendes. But what else was The Man From U.N.C.L.E if it was not a Bond-lite flick? 3. Danny Boyle Danny Boyle (Ian West/PA) 
Best known for: Directing Academy Award winner Slumdog Millionaire. 
Other notable films: Shallow Grave (1994). Trainspotting (1996). A Life Less Ordinary (1997). The Beach (2000). 28 Days Later (2002). Steve Jobs (2015). 
Bond credential: Aside from everything else, you can’t get bigger than directing The Queen and Daniel Craig in a famous 007-themed London 2012 Olympics sketch. 4. Ridley Scott Ridley Scott (HT/ABACA USA/Empics Entertainment) Best known for: Making Russell Crowe a star in Oscar-winning movie Gladiator.
Other notable films: Alien (1979). Blade Runner (1982). Thelma & Louise (1991). Black Hawk Down (2001), Hannibal (2001). American Gangster (2007). Prometheus (2012). The Martian (2015). 
Bond credential: As a seasoned movie-maker with an impressive CV, it’s no surprise his name is perennially attached to 007. 5. Kathryn Bigelow Kathryn Bigelow (John Shearer/Invision/PA) Best known for: The first female to win a best director Oscar – for The Hurt Locker.
Other notable films: Point Break (1991). Strange Days (1995). K-19: The Widowmaker (2002). Zero Dark Thirty (2012). Share article 
Bond credential: She can helm tense thrillers and her movies feature superb action set-pieces. Promoted Stories
